sourceMeaningMnemonic: You <radical>say</radical>, throwing your <radical>hat</radical> on the <radical>ground</radical> in front of the <radical>bookshelf</radical>, "I have a <kanji>theory</kanji>!" All this reading and thinking has finally given you a wonderful idea, a theory you think might solve all of your problems!
meaningInfo: This theory you've thought of is great, it's going to change everything!
readingMnemonic: "What is your theory, <reading>Ron</reading> (<ja>ろん</ja>)?" asks Hermione. You're Ron Weasley, and you just came up with a theory that you think will help you stop Voldemort.
readingInfo: "Ron? Ron, what's your theory? What's your theory, Ron?" Hermione asks over and over. But you freeze. You don't remember who you are. "Hermione, I have a theory that I was just a person learning Japanese, and not a magical boy at all." "Shut up Ron, that's a stupid theory," she replies.
